item.title: 避险黄金首次突破 4,500 美元/盎司
item.description: 由于避险需求和降息预期使金银成为受青睐的资产，现货黄金周三首次突破每盎司4,500美元的心理里程碑。【原文：Spot gold surged to break above the psychological milestone of $4,500 an ounce on Wednesday for the first time, as safe-haven demand and expectations of rate cuts kept bullion a favored asset.】

item.title: 五角大楼称洛克希德-马丁公司飞机相关合同金额增加 100 亿美元
item.description: 五角大楼周二表示，此前授予洛克希德-马丁公司的一份价值 150 亿美元的 C-130J 飞机交付、开发和工程合同已增至 250 亿美元。【原文：A previously awarded contract to Lockheed Martin related to C-130J aircraft delivery, development and engineering worth $15 billion has been increased to $25 billion, the Pentagon said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 车队管理公司 Motive Technologies 在美国首次公开募股文件中披露收入增长情况
item.description: 人工智能驱动的车队管理公司 Motive Technologies 周二在其美国首次公开募股文件中披露，该公司九个月的营收有所增长，公司正排队等待明年初上市。【原文：AI-powered fleet management company Motive Technologies on Tuesday disclosed a rise in nine-month revenue in its U.S. initial public offering filing, as companies line up to list early next year.】

item.title: 五角大楼称波音公司获得 20 亿美元发动机更换订单
item.description: 五角大楼周二表示，波音公司已获得与 B-52 商用发动机更换项目有关的 20 亿美元订单。【原文：Boeing has been awarded a $2 billion order related to the B-52 commercial engine replacement program, the Pentagon said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 投资人路易斯-培根赢得了对前时尚大亨彼得-尼加德的诽谤诉讼案
item.description: 亿万富翁、对冲基金经理路易斯-培根（Louis Bacon）声称前时尚大亨、已定罪的性犯罪者彼得-尼加德（Peter Nygard）诽谤他，称他是杀人犯、贩毒者和白人至上主义三K党成员，他赢得了这场旷日持久的诉讼。【原文：Billionaire hedge fund manager Louis Bacon has won his long-running lawsuit alleging that former fashion mogul and convicted sex offender Peter Nygard defamed him by calling him a murderer, drug trafficker and member of the white supremacist Ku Klux Klan.】

item.title: 苹果将允许第三方应用商店在巴西运营，与监管机构就 iOS 案件达成和解
item.description: 苹果公司与巴西反垄断监管机构 CADE 于周二达成和解，苹果将允许巴西的 iOS 操作系统中除苹果自己的应用程序商店外，还有其他应用程序商店。【原文：Apple will allow other app stores besides its own in the tech giant's iOS operating system in Brazil to settle a three-year case with the country's antitrust regulator CADE, both parties said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国提议解决针对 LivCor 的反竞争指控
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，已提交一份拟议的同意法令，以解决美国对 Blackstone 所投资公司 LivCor 指控其在房屋租赁市场中的反竞争行为。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it filed a proposed consent decree to resolve U.S. claims against LivCor, a Blackstone portfolio company, over alleged anticompetitive practices in housing rental markets.】

item.title: 人工智能学家为什么人工智能在工作中不起作用
item.description: 路透社技术团队本周齐聚一堂，参加我们的年终头脑风暴--借此机会回顾一下 2025 年最令我们惊讶的事情，以及 2026 年我们将密切关注的事情。【原文：The Reuters tech team gathered this week for our year-end brainstorm — a chance to step back and look at what surprised us most in 2025 and what we’ll watch closely in 2026.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止德克萨斯州旨在保护儿童的应用程序商店年龄法
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官周二阻止了德克萨斯州执行一项旨在保护儿童的新州法律，该法律要求应用程序商店和开发商核实用户年龄，苹果、Alphabet 旗下的谷歌和其他科技公司赢得了这场胜利。【原文：A federal judge in Texas on Tuesday blocked Texas from enforcing a new state law aimed at protecting children by requiring app stores and developers to verify the age of users, in a win for Apple , Alphabet's Google and other technology companies.】

item.title: 特朗普的人工智能招聘活动吸引了 2.5 万名求职者的兴趣
item.description: 特朗普政府的一位高级官员周二表示，大约有 2.5 万人已表示有兴趣加入特朗普政府的工程师队伍--"科技力量"（Tech Force），因为美国政府希望在联邦机构中安排具有人工智能专业知识的工作人员。【原文：Roughly 25,000 people have expressed interest in joining the Trump administration's cadre of engineers known as Tech Force, a senior Trump administration official said on Tuesday, as the U.S. government looks to install staff with artificial intelligence expertise in federal roles.】

item.title: 特朗普称，任何与他意见相左的人都不会成为美联储主席
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，如果市场表现良好，他希望下一任美联储主席能够降低利率，并补充说 "任何不同意我观点的人都永远不会成为美联储主席"。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he wants the next chairman of the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates if the markets are doing well, adding that "anybody that disagrees with me will never be the Fed Chairman."】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，五角大楼监察机构批评洛克希德公司的 F-35 维修故障
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周二援引政府监督机构的话报道称，由于洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）的维护缺陷，美国 F-35 战斗机在 2024 年的飞行时间只有一半左右。【原文：U.S. F-35 fighter jets were available to fly only about half the time in 2024 due to maintenance shortcomings by Lockheed Martin , Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a government watchdog.】

item.title: 美国补贴到期，奥巴马医保注册人数减少
item.description: 美国医疗保险和医疗补助服务中心（U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services）行政长官麦赫麦特-奥兹（Mehmet Oz）周二表示，根据《美国平价医疗法案》（U.S. Affordable Care Act）投保的人数从去年的约1600万降至2026年的1560万。【原文：Enrollment for health insurance under the U.S. Affordable Care Act dipped to 15.6 million for 2026, Mehmet Oz, the U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services administrator, said on Tuesday, from roughly 16 million last year.】

item.title: 白宫顾问哈塞特称国内生产总值 "非常好"，就业岗位将大幅增加
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）表示，周二报告的上一季度美国经济增长强于预期，这是唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易政策和人工智能投资的产物，预示着未来就业增长将更快。【原文：White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said stronger-than-expected U.S. economic growth reported Tuesday for last quarter is a product of President Donald Trump's trade policies and of investment in artificial intelligence, and heralds faster job gains ahead.】

item.title: 美国 12 月消费者信心指数下降
item.description: 由于对就业和收入的忧虑加深，美国消费者信心在 12 月份有所下降，这与经济学家对消费者支出在第三季度激增后大幅放缓的预期一致。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence deteriorated in December amid deepening anxiety over jobs and income, consistent with economists' expectations for a sharp moderation in consumer spending after it surged in the third quarter.】

item.title: 美国 11 月制造业生产保持不变
item.description: 由于电动汽车税收抵免到期后机动车产量下降，美国工厂产量在 10 月份下降后于 11 月份持平。【原文：U.S. factory production was unchanged in November after declining in October as motor vehicle output fell following the expiration of tax credits for electrical vehicles.】

item.title: RTX 部门雷神公司以 17 亿美元获得向西班牙供应 "爱国者 "系统的合同
item.description: 美国国防承包商雷神技术公司（RTX Corp）旗下的雷神技术公司周二表示，该公司赢得了一份价值17亿美元的合同，将向西班牙交付四套爱国者防空和导弹防御系统。【原文：Raytheon Technologies, a unit of RTX Corp , won a $1.7 billion contract to deliver four Patriot air and missile defense systems to Spain, the U.S. defense contractor said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 增长数据强于预期，美元缩减跌幅
item.description: 周二，美元兑日元和欧元的跌幅有所收敛，此前的数据显示，全球最大经济体第三季度的经济增长高于预期，这增强了美联储将在1月份会议上暂停降息的预期。【原文：The U.S. dollar curbed its losses against the yen and euro on Tuesday, after data showed the world's largest economy posted higher-than-expected growth in the third quarter, reinforcing expectations the Federal Reserve will pause cutting rates at its January meeting.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表表示，美国计划在 2027 年中期对中国芯片征收关税
item.description: 这一声明是在对中国进口美国芯片进行了长达一年的调查之后发布的。【原文：The announcement comes following a year-long investigation into China's chip imports into the United States.】

item.title: ServiceNow to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion
item.description: ServiceNow has agreed to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion in cash, the companies said on Tuesday, as the enterprise software maker looks to attract new customers amid growing risks of cyberattacks.

item.title: US core capital goods orders, shipments increase in October
item.description: New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods increased in October and shipments of these goods rose solidly, suggesting business spending on equipment remained strong at the start of the fourth quarter.

item.title: China's commerce ministry urges US to drop drone supplier ban
item.description: China's commerce ministry urged the U.S. on Tuesday to stop the "wrong practice" of adding all foreign-made drone systems and key components to its new "Covered List", and it vowed measures to protect the rights and interests of Chinese firms.

item.title: 中国 LandSpace 完成上海上市前的 "辅导 "流程
item.description: 中国领先的民营火箭公司陆地空间（LandSpace）周二向中国证券监管机构提交的一份文件显示，该公司已经完成了可能进行首次公开募股的所谓 "辅导 "程序，中国政府希望通过促进资本市场的准入来推动国内航天产业的发展。【原文：China's leading private rocket firm LandSpace has completed the so-called "tutoring" process for a potential initial public offering, a filing with the country's securities regulator showed on Tuesday, as Beijing looks to boost the domestic space industry by faciliating access to its capital markets.】

item.title: 威士卡和万事达卡报告美国假日零售额增长 4
item.description: 据威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）周二公布的初步数据显示，由于美国人在预算紧缩与渴望升级小工具和更新衣柜之间取得平衡，美国零售商的销售额在本假日季迄今已增长了约 4%。【原文：Sales for U.S. retailers have increased by about 4% so far this holiday season as Americans balanced tighter budgets with a desire to upgrade gadgets and refresh wardrobes, according to preliminary figures released by Visa and Mastercard on Tuesday.】

item.title: 华尔街期货在 GDP 数据公布前走高
item.description: 华尔街期货周二走高，投资者在等待今年最后一批关键经济数据，以寻找可能重塑明年潜在降息预期的线索。【原文：Wall Street futures ticked higher on Tuesday as investors awaited the year's final batch of key economic data for clues that could reshape expectations for potential interest rate cuts next year.】

item.title: 创纪录的一年之后，散户投资者将对华尔街有更大的影响力
item.description: 分析师表示，随着个人投资者成为美股反弹的主力军，2025 年美股的散户资金流入量将创下历史新高。【原文：Retail inflows into U.S. stocks are set to hit a record in 2025, as individual investors become a major force behind a rally that is likely to extend into the next year on hopes of interest rate cuts, analysts said.】

item.title: 主要投资者称派拉蒙对华纳兄弟的新报价不够充分
item.description: 派拉蒙天舞公司收购华纳兄弟发现公司的最新报价对著名股东哈里斯-奥克马克（Harris Oakmark）来说仍然不够好，这位投资者告诉路透社。【原文：Paramount Skydance's latest offer to buy Warner Bros Discovery still is not good enough for prominent shareholder Harris Oakmark, the investor told Reuters.】

item.title: 企业在市场上收取几分钱，以收回部分关税成本
item.description: 最高法院对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统全面征收紧急关税一案作出判决，一些美国公司正通过向外部投资者出售其收取政府可能退还的税款的权利来对冲风险。【原文：Some U.S. companies are hedging their bets on the Supreme Court case against President Donald Trump's sweeping emergency tariffs by selling their rights to collect potential government refunds of the taxes to outside investors.】

item.title: 人工智能数据中心迫使过时的 "调峰 "电厂重新投入使用
item.description: 在芝加哥的皮尔森（Pilsen）工人区，德沃夏克公园（Dvorak Park）后面的工业用地上耸立着一座 60 年代的燃油发电厂，天气暖和的时候，公园里挤满了在五颜六色的游乐场上攀爬和从滑梯上滑下来的孩子。【原文：In Chicago’s working-class Pilsen neighborhood, a 60s-era oil-fired power plant rises up from an industrial lot behind Dvorak Park, which in warmer weather is packed with children climbing on its colorful playground and zooming down slides.】

item.title: 据报道，WhatsApp 在俄罗斯的运行速度放缓，抱怨受到限制
item.description: WhatsApp 周二抱怨其在俄罗斯的服务受到限制，指责当局试图在节假日前剥夺 1 亿多俄罗斯人的私人通信权利。【原文：WhatsApp complained about restrictions to its service in Russia on Tuesday, accusing the authorities of trying to deprive more than 100 million Russians of the right to private communications before the holiday season.】
